intro: Acinodendron nodosum, commonly known as the knotted acinodendron, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive knotted stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in inflorescences at the nodes of the stems. Acinodendron nodosum is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along riverbanks.
